prompt_update: You will receive a text. Your task is to create a new original text by taking inspiration from this text. Just output your new text, nothing else. Here is the text:
initial_story:
The baby suffered a cardiac arrest at the theme park on Thursday

A woman has been arrested on suspicion of neglecting a five-month-old boy who suffered a cardiac arrest at a theme park.

The baby is in a critical condition in hospital following the incident at Legoland Windsor at about 13:00 BST on Thursday, police said.

A 27-year-old woman from Witham, Essex, was arrested on suspicion of neglecting a child to cause unnecessary injury.

She has been released on bail until 26 July.

Det Con Zoe Eele, of Thames Valley Police's Child Abuse Investigation Unit, said: "Firstly, our thoughts are with the family of the boy who is in a critical condition in hospital after suffering a cardiac arrest.

"We are working closely with the team at Legoland Windsor Resort but would like to speak to anyone who have information about this incident, specifically anyone who was queueing for the Coastguard HQ boat ride between around 11.30am and 12:45pm.

"I would ask for the public to please avoid speculation about the incident and to respect the boy's family at this deeply upsetting time."

Police said they are not looking for further suspects in relation to the incident.

In a statement, the theme park said: "On Thursday, a young guest was taken ill... and our fully trained First Aid team administered immediate care until the emergency services arrived.

"We will continue to support Thames Valley Police with their ongoing investigation."

Follow BBC South on Facebook, X, or Instagram. Send your story ideas to south.newsonline@bbc.co.uk or via WhatsApp on 0808 100 2240.

The BBC is not responsible for the content of external sites.
stories:
A toddler was rushed to the hospital after nearly drowning in a wave pool at Water World on Saturday.

A 32-year-old man has been detained on suspicion of reckless endangerment of a child after the incident at the popular water park.

The two-year-old boy is in stable condition at Children's Hospital after being pulled from the wave pool at around 3:45pm, authorities said.

The suspect, a resident of nearby Lakewood, was taken into custody and is being held at the Jefferson County Jail pending charges.

Sgt. Rachel Martinez, of the Jefferson County Sheriff's Office, urged witnesses to come forward, especially those who were in the wave pool area between 3:15pm and 4:00pm.

"We understand that this incident has caused alarm and concern among park-goers, but we ask that everyone refrain from spreading rumors and speculation," Martinez said. "Our priority is the well-being of the child and his family during this difficult time."

Water World officials released a statement saying their staff responded quickly to the emergency and provided assistance until paramedics arrived. They are cooperating fully with the investigation.

The incident serves as a reminder for parents and caregivers to remain vigilant when supervising children in and around water.

A 5-year-old girl was airlifted to a trauma center after a near-fatal accident on the bumper cars at Adventureland Amusement Park on Sunday.

A 29-year-old park employee has been arrested on suspicion of criminal negligence after the incident on the popular ride.

The young girl is in critical condition at Mercy Hospital after being thrown from the vehicle at around 7:10pm, authorities said.

The suspect, a resident of nearby Denver, was taken into custody and is being held at the Arapahoe County Jail pending charges.

Lt. James Reed, of the Arapahoe County Sheriff's Office, appealed to witnesses to come forward, especially those who were in the bumper car area between 6:45pm and 7:30pm.

"We urge everyone to remain calm and avoid speculating about the circumstances surrounding the incident," Reed said. "Our focus is on supporting the child and her family during this difficult time."

Adventureland officials released a statement saying their staff responded promptly to the emergency and provided assistance until paramedics arrived. They are fully cooperating with the investigation.

The incident serves as a reminder for parents and caregivers to be mindful of their children's safety when enjoying amusement park rides.

A 7-year-old boy was rushed to a burn center after a devastating accident on the fireworks display at Liberty Fest on Thursday.

A 35-year-old pyrotechnician has been charged with reckless endangerment following the incident, which left several others injured.

The young boy is in serious condition at St. Michael's Hospital, suffering from severe burns to his face and hands after a stray spark ignited his costume.

The suspect, a veteran fireworks expert from Chicago, was taken into custody and is being held at the Cook County Jail pending a bond hearing.

Chief Tom Harris, of the Chicago Police Department, urged witnesses to come forward, particularly those who were in the vicinity of the fireworks display between 9:30pm and 10:15pm.

"We understand the public's concern, but we ask that everyone refrain from speculation about the cause of the accident," Harris said. "Our priority is supporting the victim and his family during this challenging time."

Liberty Fest organizers released a statement saying their staff responded quickly to the emergency and provided assistance until paramedics arrived. They are fully cooperating with the investigation.

The incident serves as a stark reminder for parents and caregivers to exercise extreme caution when enjoying fireworks displays with children.

A 9-year-old girl was airlifted to a trauma center after a horrific incident at the SummerFest carnival on Saturday.

A 42-year-old ride operator has been arrested on suspicion of negligence following the accident, which left several others shaken.

The young girl is in critical condition at Mercy Hospital, suffering from severe head and neck injuries after a faulty safety harness failed on the spinning coaster ride.

The suspect, a 10-year veteran of the carnival circuit from Texas, is being held at the county detention center pending a bail hearing.

Sheriff Rachel Martinez, of the County Sheriff's Department, urged witnesses to step forward, particularly those who were in the vicinity of the coaster ride between 8:45pm and 9:30pm.

"We understand the public's outrage, but we ask that everyone refrain from speculation about the cause of the accident," Martinez said. "Our focus is on supporting the victim and her family during this difficult time."

SummerFest organizers released a statement saying their staff responded promptly to the emergency and provided assistance until paramedics arrived. They are fully cooperating with the investigation.

The incident serves as a sobering reminder for parents and caregivers to prioritize safety above all else when enjoying amusement park rides with children.

A 12-year-old boy was rushed to a pediatric ICU after a devastating accident on the "Tornado" thrill ride at Oceanview Amusement Park on Sunday evening.

A 35-year-old ride mechanic has been charged with reckless endangerment following the incident, which left multiple riders traumatized.

The young boy is fighting for his life, suffering from severe spinal cord injuries and a punctured lung after a malfunctioning safety bar gave way on the high-speed rollercoaster.

The suspect, a 5-year veteran of the park's maintenance team, is being held without bail pending a psychological evaluation.

Police Chief Michael Rodriguez, of the Coastal Police Department, urged anyone with photos or videos of the incident to come forward, particularly those who were in the Tornado ride's queue between 9:15pm and 9:45pm.

"We understand the community's concern, but we implore everyone to avoid spreading rumors about the cause of the accident," Rodriguez said. "Our priority is supporting the victim and his family during this extremely difficult time."

Oceanview Amusement Park officials released a statement saying their emergency response team reacted swiftly to the crisis and provided aid until paramedics arrived. They are fully cooperating with the authorities.

The incident serves as a stark reminder for parents and guardians to thoroughly inspect safety features and listen to ride operators' instructions before allowing children to ride high-risk attractions.

A 9-year-old girl was airlifted to a trauma center after a horrific crash on the "Storm Chaser" log flume ride at Thunderbrook Water Park on a sweltering summer afternoon.

A 28-year-old lifeguard has been accused of criminal negligence following the incident, which left several witnesses shaken.

The young girl is in critical condition, suffering from severe head trauma and a broken collarbone after a faulty lap bar failed to secure her in place on the treacherous water slide.

The suspect, a 3-year veteran of the park's lifeguard team, is being detained pending a thorough investigation into their certification and training.

Fire Marshal Rachel Patel, of the Thunderbrook Fire Department, appealed to anyone with eyewitness accounts or recordings of the incident to step forward, especially those who were in the Storm Chaser ride's splash zone between 2:45pm and 3:15pm.

"We understand the public's alarm, but we urge everyone to refrain from speculating about the cause of the accident," Patel said. "Our focus is on supporting the victim and her loved ones during this agonizing time."

Thunderbrook Water Park officials issued a statement saying their emergency response team sprang into action to mitigate the crisis and provided assistance until paramedics arrived. They are fully cooperating with the authorities.

The incident serves as a sobering reminder for parents and caregivers to meticulously check safety restraints and heed ride operators' warnings before allowing children to ride high-risk attractions.

A 12-year-old boy was rushed to a burns unit after a devastating explosion on the "Inferno Coaster" rollercoaster at Emberwood Amusement Park on a chilly autumn evening.

A 35-year-old ride operator has been accused of reckless endangerment following the incident, which left numerous onlookers traumatized.

The young boy is in serious condition, suffering from severe burns to his arms and legs after a malfunctioning safety harness failed to protect him during the ride's dramatic drop.

The suspect, a 5-year veteran of the park's operations team, is being held pending a comprehensive investigation into their maintenance and inspection procedures.

Sheriff James Reed, of the Emberwood Sheriff's Department, appealed to anyone with eyewitness accounts or footage of the incident to come forward, particularly those who were in the Inferno Coaster's queue between 8:15pm and 8:45pm.

"We understand the public's outrage, but we urge everyone to refrain from speculating about the cause of the accident," Reed said. "Our focus is on supporting the victim and his family during this difficult time."

Emberwood Amusement Park officials issued a statement saying their emergency response team swiftly responded to the crisis and provided assistance until firefighters arrived. They are fully cooperating with the authorities.

The incident serves as a stark warning for thrill-seekers and parents to be vigilant about ride safety and to report any concerns to park staff before boarding high-risk attractions.

A 9-year-old girl was airlifted to a trauma center after a catastrophic accident on the "Storm Chaser" waterslide at Splashville Water Park on a sweltering summer afternoon.

A 28-year-old lifeguard has been taken into custody on suspicion of criminal negligence following the incident, which left many park-goers in shock.

A 12-year-old boy was rushed to a nearby hospital after a terrifying malfunction on the "Tornado Twister" rollercoaster at Thrilltopia Amusement Park on a bustling evening.

A 35-year-old ride operator has been arrested on suspicion of reckless endangerment following the incident, which sent shockwaves throughout the crowded park.

The young boy is in stable condition, suffering from a severe concussion and a shattered ankle after a faulty safety harness failed to secure him properly, causing him to be thrown from the ride's carriage.

The suspect, a 5-year veteran of the park's operations team, is being held pending a thorough investigation into their adherence to maintenance protocols and emergency response procedures.

A 28-year-old lifeguard has been fired and is facing charges of criminal negligence following the incident, which sparked chaos throughout the packed water park.

The young girl is in critical condition, suffering from severe spinal cord injuries and lacerations after a defective safety gate failed to prevent her from being swept away by the ride's powerful water currents.

The former lifeguard, a 3-year veteran of the park's aquatics team, is under investigation for allegedly ignoring warning signs of equipment failure and neglecting to perform routine safety checks.

SplashWorld Water Park officials released a statement saying their emergency response team responded promptly to the emergency and provided assistance until paramedics arrived. The former lifeguard, a 3-year veteran of the park's aquatic team, is under investigation for allegedly ignoring warnings from colleagues about the pump's malfunction and failing to evacuate the ride promptly.

"We understand the public's need for transparency, but we must prioritize the investigation," Reed said. "Our focus is on supporting the victim's family and ensuring that OceanBreeze Water Park takes all necessary measures to prevent such incidents in the future."

OceanBreeze Water Park officials released a statement saying their emergency response team responded swiftly to the emergency and provided assistance until paramedics arrived. The incident serves as a sobering reminder for families and water enthusiasts to be cautious about ride safety and to report any concerns to park staff before using high-risk attractions.

A 35-year-old lead mechanic has been suspended without pay pending a thorough investigation for allegedly disregarding crucial safety protocols prior to the malfunction, which sent panic rippling through the crowds.
